alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 06 at 2:49PM CDT until June 06 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... * Until 230 PM MDT. * At 146 PM MDT, a Gordon Rushville fire department reported a landspout tornado briefly touching down 11 miles west of Merriman, or 17 miles northeast of Gordon, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspout tornado. SOURCE...Emergency management confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * The tornado will be near... Merriman around 215 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Highway 61 Crossing The Niobrara River and Irwin. # # This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 121 and 142. Highway 61 between mile markers 212 and 228. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a landspout tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
